title: 8-Stage Shift Register with Control Inputs
description: This function block implements an 8-stage shift register operation with the capability to set/reset its states based on control inputs. It supports data input from two different sources, allowing the user to either shift data through the register or load new values upon a rising edge of the clock signal.
name: SHR_8UDE

input.name: SET
input.description: Input to set the state of the shift register.

input.name: D0
input.description: Input data for the first stage of the shift register.

input.name: D7
input.description: Input data for the last stage of the shift register.

input.name: CLK
input.description: Clock input signal that triggers the shifting of the register.

input.name: DN
input.description: Control input to determine the direction of data shifting.

input.name: RST
input.description: Input to reset all registers to a known state.

output.name: Q0
output.description: Current output state of the first stage of the shift register.

output.name: Q1
output.description: Current output state of the second stage of the shift register.

output.name: Q2
output.description: Current output state of the third stage of the shift register.

output.name: Q3
output.description: Current output state of the fourth stage of the shift register.

output.name: Q4
output.description: Current output state of the fifth stage of the shift register.

output.name: Q5
output.description: Current output state of the sixth stage of the shift register.

output.name: Q6
output.description: Current output state of the seventh stage of the shift register.

output.name: Q7
output.description: Current output state of the eighth stage of the shift register.
